page.title: 10Bower Hall Estate, cont.
page.content: When the present owners father took over the farm about 35 years ago, whilst clearing the lime trees which lined the drive and most of the other trees from the Park, remains of a brick built{tunnel}were unearthed. This tunnel is believed to have run from the{Hall}to the{Church. }The Park area was sold about 20 years ago to Tanner & Wicks and plans were passed to build the{Bower Hall Estate}of some 150 houses. Also incorporated is {Bendyshe Court}(sheltered accommodation for the elderly) and the Infants School. There is a largish pond at the farm on which live and breed ducks, geese and guinea fowl. There is also a peacock and peahen. A few bantams are kept for eggs and pheasants are bred for sport. There are two horses, a small stable and a hay barn, but no other livestock.
